course_description: This course will take a systems/lifespan approach, integrating anatomy, physiology, and pathophysiology related to anesthesiology. Foci include the effects of general and regional anesthesia in patients with renal, hepatic, endocrine, neuromuscular, congenital heart, and genetic based disorders.
prerequisites: NRSG 784 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 5242, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 8:30-11:20a, Instructor: Staff, Status: Open
